topic.title: CLIMATE: Farm Process V4 Climate Options

para.text: CLIMATE: Farm Process V4 Climate Options
The CLIMATE: Farm Process V4 Climate Options pane is used to activate the climate options in the Farm Process in MODFLOW-OWHM version 2 and specify options for it. It is in the
The climate data is all specified on a cell-by-cell (array) basis so the
dialog box is not used with MODFLOW-OWHM version 2.
If POTENTIAL_EVAPORATION_BARE is not specified, then Fallow/Bare soil automatically uses 0.5*ETref to obtain a potential evaporation rate for bare soil.

Precipitation that falls on the model domain (L/T). Only the precipitation that falls within a cell defined with a nonzero WBS (FARM) ID is simulated, any zero WBS ID cells have precipitation set to zero. If static, the
data set is used. If transient, it is specified as a MODFLOW Feature in the
data set is used. If transient, it is specified as a MODFLOW Feature in the

Reference ET (L/T) If not specified, then REFERENCE_ET is set to 0.0. This is required there are fallow/bare soil cells, Crop Coefficients (Kc) specified, or Crops specified as FRACTIONS (multiple crops per model cell). If static, the
data set is used. If transient, it is specified as a MODFLOW Feature in the
Potential ET rate of bare soil:

POTENTIAL_EVAPORATION_BARE is an Optional keywords that define how Bare Soil Potential Evaporation is calculated. Potential evaporation rate of groundwater under Fallow and Bare Soil. If not specified then REFERENCE_ET is used in its place. If REFERENCE_ET is not specified then set to 0.0. If static, the
data set is used. If transient, it is specified as a MODFLOW Feature in the

DIRECT_RECHARGE Specify recharge that is sent directly to the bottom of the root zone. The recharge is not consumed by crops and is treated as deep percolation. The deep percolation is then passed to either UZF or the water table.
The keyword LENGTH indicates that the input is in model units of length (L/T)
The keyword RATE indicates that the input is in volumetric rate (L
This feature mimics both the RCH package Infiltration and UZF Recharge.
data set is used. If transient, it is specified as a MODFLOW Feature in the

PRECIPITATION_POTENTIAL_CONSUMPTION is an optional keyword that specifies by the model grid potential consumption of precipitation. This limits how much precipitation can be consumed as evaporation and transpiration based on the quantity of rainfall and is analogous to specifying an effective precipitation, which represents the quantity of rainfall that is not runoff nor deep percolation. This is a spatial based input equivalent to the SOIL block's keyword
BY_LENGTH indicates the array specifies the effective precipitation (L/T) as an upper limit of consumption.
BY_FRACTION indicates the array is a 0 to 1 fraction of the precipitation that is available for consumption. That is the the fraction times precipitation is the effective precipitation.
available for consumption becomes either runoff or deep percolation.
available for consumption, but is not consumed as ET becomes either runoff or deep percolation.
data set is used. If transient, it is specified as a MODFLOW Feature in the
